channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Doctors Without Borders kicked out of Gaza: Israel suspends dozens of humanitarian organizations over new registration rules
item.description: Israel says the rules are aimed at preventing Hamas and other militant groups from infiltrating the aid organizations.

item.title: No, the White House can’t defund the CFPB, judge says, just days before agency would run out of cash
item.description: At the heart of this case is whether budget bigwig Russell Vought can effectively shut down the agency and lay off all of the bureau's employees.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Right About ‘Gender-Affirming Care’
item.description: The HHS secretary, to say the least, isn’t always very careful about evidence, but, on this one, the most painstaking research is on his side.

item.title: DHS looks to demolish historic St Elizabeths buildings due to 'unacceptable' risks
item.description: Historic St. Elizabeths buildings face demolition as DHS claims emergency conditions. The move is facing pushback from preservation groups.

item.title: Let’s Leave Trump Impressions Behind With 2025
item.description: Happy New Year. RIP Trump impressions.

item.title: The show won't go on: Jazz band joins cancellations at Trump-Kennedy Center over name change
item.description: Another act said it won't perform at the Trump-Kennedy Center, this time on New Year's Eve, after President Trump's name was added to the building.

item.title: AOC to deliver opening remarks at Mamdani's inauguration, Bernie Sanders to administer oath of office
item.description: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani's historic inauguration will feature Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., and Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt.

item.title: 2025: A Year in Reading
item.description: If there was one bookshelf theme this year, it was liberals discovering the concept of abundance.

item.title: Before You Make Any Lofty New Year’s Resolutions, Go Clean Your Room
item.description: Before deciding on any big changes in 2026, try starting with the bedroom.

item.title: Are These Iran Protests Different?
item.description: The Iranian people are at the end of their rope, and they’re letting their dissatisfaction be known.

item.title: An AI super-bull who just backed the Nvidia-Groq deal warns of a data center bust: ‘We foresee a significant financial crisis’
item.description: Alex Davis says third-party data-center developers will eventually be jilted by the hyperscalers they serve, and face a subsequent debt crisis.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK and cousin of Health Secretary RFK Jr., dies of cancer at 35
item.description: Her death comes just weeks after she publicly revealed in The New Yorker that she had been diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia.

item.title: Buddhist monks peace-walking from Texas to DC persist even after being run over on highway outside Houston

item.title: Ben Sasse Reminds Us That Life Is Precious
item.description: The former senator announced last week that he has advanced cancer and does not expect to survive.

item.title: Minneapolis Daycare Scandal Reveals The Trajectory Of Blue Zone Fraud Culture
item.description: Blue Zone political culture is empty. There’s nothing in it. They don’t make anything, they don’t do anything, they aren’t trying to do anything.
